title: Survivor Man
description: After Michael isn't invited to a camping trip with Ryan, he sets out to prove that he can brave it out in the wilderness by himself. Jim, who is in charge of the office while Michael is gone, tries to change the birthday party policy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I really didn't think I was going to have a good time, but I did. Totally did.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I love camping. [in a singing voice] Anything can happen.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, it wasn't camping, it was more of a wilderness retreat. [Michael walks in]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Morning.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ryan invited some of the branch managers and Toby into the woods for a "get to know you" weekend. Michael wasn't invited. Apparently they already knew everything they needed to know about him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you sleep in cabins?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Under the stars. It was really beautiful, you should come.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bob and I took rock climbing lessons once. [Michael laughs]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael wasn't invited on Ryan's camping trip. Toby went, but Michael didn't go. He wasn't invited.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who went?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Me, Dan from Buffalo, Mark Chisholm, Jeff from Albany and Ryan, obviously. Made so many s'mores, that I finally had to say, "No more s'mores, no more s'mores." [everyone in room but Michael laughs, Michael exits break room]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ryan invited me to go on his wilderness adventure retreat. It was this amazing, beautiful experience [Michael knocks on the window behind Toby from outside]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [from outside] Hey, nobody cares. Nobody cares. I need that room at some point, so just, wrap it up.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael wasn't invited.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hypothetically, if I were to ask you to go camping, and you know what hypothetical means? [Jim makes a face] Not real.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So if I were to hypothetically ask you to go camping with me, would you go?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely, yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When Michael plays the hypothetical game, I always say yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you wanna go today?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I am always busy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, can't go today, 'cause I'm donating blood.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How often can you actually donate blood?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is there a limit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your body only has a certain amount.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, is that it? Or?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, just this whole Toby, camping thing, uh, seems a little lame.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How so?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A bunch of guys, in a tent? Making s'mores? [makes a noise and gestures with his hands]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, I'm Broken Mountain. You know, here's the thing. That's not how you go camping. I think you go camping by yourself--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In the wilderness. It's not with a group of guys frolicking around in tents. It's one guy, or two guys, if your plans change.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not gonna change.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wanna do it myself. You know, I want to go and, and find out something about myself, I wanna get outta here. All the cliques, and the office politics. Fluorescent lights. Asbestos.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I thought we had that looked at.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sick of it Jim. I'm sick of this place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When Jan and I had satellite, we used to watch a reality show called "Survivorman." And, it was interesting because it was about a guy who would go out in the middle of no where and just try not to die, try not to get eaten by an animal, or be overexposed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, I will only need two things. Roll of duct tape and a knife.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [winks] I'm on it. [leaves room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Thirty minutes or less, please come back. Save the receipts. [Dwight comes back with set of knives] Hey, what...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's see if any of these will work. [clears the front of Michael's desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey hey! Dwight. [Dwight rolls out an assortment knives]. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I keep various weaponries strategically placed around the office. I saved Jim's life with a can of pepper spray I had velcroed under my desk. People say, "Oh, it's dangerous to keep weapons in the home or the work place." Well I say, "It's better to be hurt by someone you know accidentally, than by a stranger on purpose."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight and I are going out. He will return later, but I will not. I will also be taking a personal day tomorrow, and perhaps the next day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want me to ask where you're going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight will be driving me deep into the Pennsylvania wilderness.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where he will then leave me to either die or to survive. The choice is yours.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm, no, the choice is actually yours. Are you sure you want to do this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, and I am leaving you in charge of the office for the rest of the day and for the next several days. Do not try to follow me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is a very personal, private experience in the wild, that I wish to share it with me, myself and I.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I return, I hope to be a completely changed human being.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That'd be great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do I believe that Michael possesses the skills to survive in a hostile environment? Let's put it this way:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is what a true survivor man does. You simulate a disaster, like a plane wreck. You could only wear the clothes that you have on, and you could only use the stuff you have in your pockets. Now, in this case, this disaster is a serial killer. Creepy guy who's abducted me and is taking me out into the wilderness to leave me for dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I would never leave you for dead. You would never escape.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yes I would. And I would survive.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would make sure that you were dead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: First, I would remove your teeth and cut off your fingertips so you could not be identified.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And they would call me the Overkill Killer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You... you are as creepy as a real serial killer. For real. [blindfolds eyes with tie] OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am putting this on so I have no familiarity with my surroundings. Now this way, I can't retrace my steps. I don't know what streets we've been-- [Dwight whacks Michael with his shoe] Ow! What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It would be better if you were unconscious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! Gosh! Dwight. [Dwight tries to hit Michael with his shoe again] Stop it, stop it! Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you want to do this right or not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just, please allow me to have one cathartic experience in my life?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Jim, we need to order a cake for Creed's birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, wasn't it just someone's birthday?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes. Kelly's was last week, remember?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I do remember, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's birthday month. Creed's is today. Oscar's is week after next. Meredith's is at the end of the month. [Jim exhales deeply] Michael usually goes with red and white streamers...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what, I have an idea. Why don't we just do one big shared party?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There are thirteen people working in this office, so thirteen times a year Michael gets a cake and balloons, and some sort of joke gift and makes a toast. There are two types of toasts. One is a joke about how old you are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [flashback to Stanley's birthday] Look at those wrinkles. Blacks do crack! Not crack the drug.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And the other is something inappropriate. Or horrible. Or both. What else? He only sings the high harmony to "Happy Birthday." And he's a very big believer in surprise parties. Maybe even, arguably, possibly to a fault.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [flashback to Kelly's birthday, hiding in the elevator] Happy Birthday!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ahhh!! [drops the papers she was holding]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [flashback to Oscar's birthday, hiding in the break room] Happy Birthday!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ahhh! [runs into door and Michael laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [flashback to Phyllis' birthday, sneaking up on Phyllis' car] Happy Birthday!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh! [Michael laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So... I think, yeah, I think getting these out of the way might be productive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can just have one big fun party. Everybody's happy, nobody wastes their time.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't like it. [Angela leaves]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow! You're shaking things up a bit, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's a pretty good idea, don't you think?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you think it's a good idea?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No... I think it's a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [smiles] Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We're here. [gets out of the car]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight will take my blindfold off when we are deep in the forest. Just the two of us from this point out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [leading Michael from car] Here we go. Just the two of us [gestures for camera crew to follow]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here we go, into the wild. Mighty forest. Can you smell the trees and the nature?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Keep going, you're fine. Just some bushes and some thickets [leads Michael into some tall grass] Keep going. You wanted wilderness, you got it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, try sending them another invoice.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. [starts walking away, but returns] Oh, did you see my memo by the way?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [picks up and reads memo] "Let's be honest, as fun as birthdays are we could all use a break from the constant cake, so let's celebrate birthday month in style today." This is really cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right? I was just thinking...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, totally, totally. This way we get it all out of the way at once and it could actually be fun.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right! Exactly. [pats Oscar on the back and walks away] Knew I could count on you. [Oscar rolls his eyes]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good a spot as any. [They stop and Dwight starts spinning Michael around in circles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing? Stop. Dwight, Dwight. Just --

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm just --

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Spin. I'm trying to confuse your sense of direction. [stops spinning and takes Michael's blindfold off] Behold.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, good. Thank you, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here's your knife. Here's your duct tape.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, very good. Ahh, OK. [Dwight gives Michael a hug]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good luck, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks for the ride. OK. Leave me be, Dwight. [Dwight runs off]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, Jim, can I have my own cake?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I really prefer devils food cake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, sure.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. [Meredith leaves]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow! That was easy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, people like me I guess.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [knocking from outside window in break room] Jim.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I hate devils food.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well I think Meredith was just --

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Screw Meredith, I don't think it's fair to let someone else pick the cake on my birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Everybody's birthday.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Today is actually my birthday and I want to pick the cake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do you want?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I want pie. I want peach pie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You want a birthday pie?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I want a nice cobbler.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I'm gonna to talk to Angela and we're gonna see what we can do about a pie.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don't care who you talk to. Just make it happen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It will be Angela.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You tell her it's for Creed. She'll know what that means.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to own camcorder] Day One. I'm in the interior of the vast Pennsylvania wilderness. I've brought with me only the bare essentials. A knife, roll of duct tape, in case I need to craft some shelter or make some sort of water vessel. It's hot today. The sun is in the two-thirds easterly quadrant, which would make it about [looks at watch] 2 o'clock in the afternoon. It's really beating down on me now. I think that I want to get a little more comfortable because the sun is depleting my resources. [cuts pants with knife] OK. OH, there we go. Watch that I don't hit my corroded artery here...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I lied to Michael. I said that I would leave him alone, but I will not. I will remain close by to provide unseen moral support, but I will never help him. I will let harm befall him. I will even let him die. But I will never let him lose his dignity.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There we go. [standing with short sleeves and short pants] Much better. Now everything I brought with me can be used. My sport coat here, can be fashioned into a backpack of sorts [ties jacket around neck].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to wear what was once one of my pant legs. [puts pant leg on head like a hat]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See, this is a beautiful piece of material [rips other pant leg in half] This could be used for all sorts of things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Some sort of kerchief to keep my neck nice and comfortable.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna. [rolls in chair to Jim's desk]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Me likey the ice cream cake, okay? Fudgie the Whale.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not your birthday.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I'm just saying, you know, if you want to make people happy, namely me, you will have a Fudgie the Whale.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, I'll look into it, but the answer's no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow, OK, harsh. Just don't expect me to show up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Andy, I have some calls to make.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Loud and clear. [rolls in chair back to desk]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. [Andy rolls back]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pizza rolls.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, I'm gonna go into this office here [gets up and walks into Michael's office] to do some work. So I will be in here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mushroom caps.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am totally alone right now, with only my thoughts. I love it. I'm loving it. I can literally say anything I want. No one is gonna here me. [screams] Wish I could have gone with Ryan on that cool retreat! Jan has plastic boobs! I HAVE HEMORRHOIDS! Doesn't even matter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael is a man of great depth and passion. I don't know what he's searching for out here. [pulls a nest from a tree] I hope he finds it. [picks up some bird eggs] Lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well it is a little chillier than I had thought, so I have fashioned my hat back into my pants. Several hours in, time for me to find some nourishment. Now, these woods are full of creatures that can sustain human life. Things like, uh, squirrels, nice juicy rabbit would be delicious.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: About two more minutes [cooking bird eggs].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have made this spear, with which I will impale my dinner. And it couldn't come a moment too soon because I have been without food for a good three hours or so. I'm startin' to feel it a little bit. Ohh... It's Creed's birthday. [singing] Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to Creed. Happy Birthday to you. Happy birthday, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What is Jim thinking? It's a birthday, so what if there's a lot of them?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I work hard all day. I like knowing that there's going to be a break. Most days I just sit and wait for the break.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I took an extra shot of insulin in preparation for this cake today. If I don't have some cake soon, I might die.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why don't you just have an apple?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why don't you mind your business?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Listen, I figured this out. Jimmy had his birthday three weeks ago, so he doesn't care.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Probably went to his head.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yeah. [Jim enters room]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey guys, what're we talking about?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Nothing! Nothing going on. We're talking about nothing. C'mon gang.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well if you take a look at this, I tented my pants. I've made myself a nice pants tent shelter. And this little guy [pats a large tree trunk] may be Dunder Mifflin paper some day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nothing to worry about. Just using the scope. Safety is... [clicks rifle into safety mode] on.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [knocks] Hey Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, I just got the word on the communal birthdays. Great idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, thanks man.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is there anything --

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: My birthday was two months ago.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, OK.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: There was no party.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, it... there was. But Michael scheduled it for 4:58 on a Friday. You know, people sang in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I remember that.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't know, I just thought you could include me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I just though you could add me.  I don't see the harm in that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Toby's great. He's great, but sometimes he can be a little bit much. [in Toby voice] I don't see the harm in that. Well, it's a cake Toby, so, c'mon.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. Yeah, you know what, we're just gonna throw you in. Because more the merrier, right?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. No way. I am not a machine, Jim. You can't just change plans willy nilly and expect these little magic party elves to do your bidding. We already have devils food, peach cobbler, Fudgie the Whale, mushroom caps.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm allergic to mushrooms.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's a bummer. OK, then we need to...[steps outside office] Hey everybody. Hi, how you doing? Can I have your attention please?  'Cause we have to talk about this birthday thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [raises hand] Conference room?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, conference room in five minutes... No. No. We're gonna solve it right here. We're actually gonna talk about it out here. So, who has problems with the birthday thing? [everyone raises hands] One, two, three, everybody. OK, so then we just shouldn't do it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What am I supposed to do with two cakes and a pie?'

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I'll take 'em.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Well nobody's touching my cobbler.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [raises hand] Hey, Michael. I mean Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup, Phyllis called me Michael. And I will always and forever be haunted by that fact.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Under this tree, I think I struck the mother load. Those [points camera to mushrooms] are nature's best mushrooms. Wild, and I have to say these little buggers are damn tasty as well. [puts them in mouth]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop! No, no Michael! Nooo! Nooo! [runs up to Michael and knocks him over] Nooo! Arghh. Get, get them out. [picks out mushrooms from Michael's mouth]

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday to you. Happy Birthday [Michael joins in with high note] to Creed. Happy Birthday to you. [Creed blows up candles on pie]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! [everybody clapping] Alright, skip around the room. Skip around the room. We want -- OK, alright. Yeah, don't do that. You're gonna break something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Man became civilized for a reason. He decided that he liked to have warmth, and clothing, and television, and hamburgers, and to walk upright, and to have a soft futon at the end of the day. He didn't want to have to struggle to survive. I don't need the woods. I have a nice wood desk. I don't need fresh  air, because I have the freshest air around, A.C. And I don't need wide open spaces. Check it out. [shows off computer screen scenery] I can also make it the sky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure glad you're back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are relieved.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what did I miss?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I tried to put all the birthdays together at once.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, terrible idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, okay, I did that. Rookie mistake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You did do it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh huh. Yeah, just wait. Ten years, you'll figure it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I don't think I'll be here in ten years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's what I said. That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's what who said?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I never know. I just say it. I say stuff like that, you know, to lighten the tension. When things sort of get hard.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Nice. Really good. Bravo, my young ward.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come in!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, it's Creed's birthday today.  Should we get him an ice-cream cake?  Mint chocolate chip?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, are you my friend?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have been friends forever, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I have been working with you forever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hypothetically... would you go camping with me, if I were to ask you?  And bear in mind that I would never actually ask you to go camping.  That Jim is also a friend of mine, and I would rather die than make any sort of improper ovation toward you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here's the thing.  When Michael invents a hypothetical situation, he eventually turns it into an actual situation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you understand that Jim is like a brother to me, and I would never do anything inappropriate?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, as friends, would you go with me on a camping trip?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you for your honesty.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're welcome.  Open or closed?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Split the difference.  Hey... mint chocolate chip, please?  Is Jim out there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can you send Dwight in here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.  Dwight, Michael wants to see you in his office. [Dwight runs in]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhmm.  I had something very personal I would like to discuss. [Dwight closes door, takes off glasses, kneels in front of Michael's desk]  Would you go find Jim, and send him in here, please?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm on it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael has employed Dwight to track you down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How much time do I have?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, Michael's office.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Couple minutes, give or take.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And this... is a Hassenfass.  Case-hardened steel.  One side, as sharp as you'd ever want something to be.  The other side serrated for maximum damage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look at that.  Perfectly balanced.  This is a fine precision instrument.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Dexter, just give me the knife.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't you want a sheath for that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, just get me a case. [Dwight looks at the camera, lifts his leg onto the desk, removes the sheath from his ankle, and gives it to Michael]  All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Anything else?  Flint...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: MmMmm.  All I need...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Parka...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tent, rainfly, gorp...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm telling you, all I will need are my instincts and my will to survive.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmmnnnnmmm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding up knife] What is this called again?
